textBox.richText: From left to right on the picture: Jean-Pierre Gehrig, Jan Erik Solem, Oliver Heckmann, Ricardo Baeza-Yates, Johan Oomen, Sébastien Marcel, Hans van Gageldonk, Roelof van Zwol, Yiannis Kompatsiaris and Stéphane Marchand-Maillet. On July 10 2009, I had the privilege to chair together with Roelof van Zwol from Yahoo! Research the Practitioner Day (http://www.civr2009.org/pd) of the ACM International Conference on Image and Video Retrieval (CIVR) in Santorini. That day started with a keynote given by Dr. Ricardo Baeza-Yates from Yahoo! Research Barcelona on “Mining the Web 2.0 for Improved Image Search” as well as various talks on “Distributed Media on the Web” and “Media in post-production and broadcasting” given by a wide range of speakers including Oliver Heckmann from Google Zurich, Jan Erik Solem from Polar Rose, Johan Oomen from Beeld En Geluid, Hans van Gageldonk from Philips Research Laboratories, Jean-Pierre Gehrig from Cinetis, Xavier Vives from Corporaci´o Catalana de Mitjans Audiovisuals and Baris Sumengen from Like.com (formerly Riya). This work has been supported by the European PASCAL NoE (http://www.pascal-network.org) and the Swiss National Center of Competence in Research IM2 (http://www.im2.ch). I would like to thank the EU and the Swiss National Science Foundation for the financial support.
